Key Match Events: James Harden had 24 points and 12 rebounds, Norman Powell added 24 points and the Los Angeles Clippers barely hung on to beat the Toronto Raptors 105-103 on Saturday night
Post-Match Reflections: The Los Angeles Clippers have won four straight victories
The Toronto Raptors have lost three straight and seven of eight
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Intuit Dome, where the Clippers have won three straight after starting 0-4
Kawhi Leonard still hasn't played this season while rehabilitating his right knee
Others: Kevin Porter Jr. had 15 points in his highest-scoring performance since returning to the NBA this fall
Ochai Agbaji and Immanuel Quickley scored 21 points apiece for the Raptors
